abstract: Thousands of people protest in Tunis over the television broadcast of animated film Persepolis, considered blasphemous by Islamists; mob firebombs the home of the TV station owner.
snippet: The police in Tunis used tear gas to disperse thousands of people protesting the TV broadcast of “Persepolis,” an animated film Islamists have called blasphemous.
lead_paragraph: The police in Tunis used tear gas to disperse thousands of people protesting the TV broadcast of “Persepolis,” an animated film Islamists have called blasphemous.
